I think this is caused by a improper way of zeroing the swerve module. We’ve been using swerves from swerve drive specialties for three years but still didn’t find a way to zero it properly. Recently, I’ve noticed that \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eWCP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"West Coast Products\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e’s swerve modules provide either mounting holes or a 3D printed block to zero the modules, and I wondered whether or not \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eSDS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Swerve Drive Specialties\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e provides such a thing.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T15:36:37.742Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":69.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496079,"topic_slug":"about-mk4n-zeroing","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60059,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/about-mk4n-zeroing/496079/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3560649,"name":"Chase Eid","username":"PixL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pixl/{size}/250824_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T15:37:53.670Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eOurs automatically figures it out.
